Description:
Sweet Abode on Picturesque Hectare of Land
This delightful property is sure to win the hearts of those seeking a weekender or those chasing the lifestyle of a space and serenity. The property measuring just over two and a half acres is on the outskirts of town and is high set on top of rise taking in views across the countryside. The land offers great potential for extra shedding and gradually slopes down to a creek. The home is very comfortable with two generous bedrooms, a sunny living area and a functional kitchen. Come and enjoy a relaxed lifestyle or maybe bring a horse or two.
Insights: 3580 Ballarat-Maryborough Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2018 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Ideal Clunes Grazing Block, 15.88 Acres with a Great Outlook
Situated just over 2 kilometres from the Clunes Township and offering a frontage of approx. 160 metres. The land is cleared and for the last 30 years has been leased to a neighbour to run livestock. Fenced into one large paddock, the allotment is Zoned Farming under the Hepburn Shire Council property number 13552. Mains power is located in a pit at the front boundary, north east corner. The land is also in a water catchment area managed by Central Highlands Water Ballarat. An application for a dwelling on this lot would need a strong farm management plan to justify why a house is needed.
Land area of approx. 15.88 acres or 6.42 hectares, this elevated parcel of land provides a unique setting with a view of Mount Beckworth and lends itself as an ideal grazing block or for recreational activities, and just 30 minutes from Ballarat.
Insights: 225 Learmonth Road, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2020.

Includes: 2 living areas, kitchen/dining, combustion wood fire place plus lpg heating and electric hws. Views to Mt Beckworth.

Description:
2.50 Acre Building Block
Situated 30 minutes drive from Ballarat and 15 minutes to Maryborough is this north facing allotment comprising of 2.50 acres or approx. 1 hectare. Zoned low density residential under the Hepburn Shire Planning Scheme, 132 Fairview Road would be an ideal building allotment subject to council approval.
The land is flat and fenced into one paddock; approx. 95% is cleared with a small cluster of trees providing shelter and shade for your livestock. Features include a sealed road and mains power pole at the front with a transformer, and town water is connected to the block. The school bus also passes at the front, and you are 3 kilometres from the main street of Clunes via Alfred Street which has recently been sealed.
Insights: 132 Fairview Road, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015.

Description:
8.48HA (20.95 Acres) Two of Everything & Space That Will Please Everyone
Experience the advantages of dual occupancy living with the benefits of semi-rural living. This substantial comprises of two homes sharing a double carport and a full length sunroom y and accommodates 6 bedrooms, 2 living zones, 2 kitchens and 2 bathrooms. Fenced into 5 paddocks the home offers an array of handy sundry shedding (including office) and water will always be in abundance with problem town water connected and five dams. A rare opportunity, well situated on the Ballarat only 15 minutes from Ballarat and 5 minutes from the ever popular historic township of Clunes.

Description:
3.46 acres of Peace and Quiet
At the end of a quiet court, just a few minutes from the centre of town, is this ideal building block (STCA). A Patch of Paradise for Ponies & owners alike, surrounded by mature Gum Trees and a variety of Australian Native shrubs & wattles. The property includes 2 paddocks with an animal shelter to protect from the elements. Soil test also available along with 'Letter of No Objection' from Central Highlands Water Authority. Power, water & telephone all available.

Description:
Loads of Interest in this Clunes allotment
A sense of peace and serenity is offered from this sensational allotment of over 1000m2 (more than acre) which provides stunning distance views over the district spanning over 180 degrees with all Clunes services available.
Two stunning old churches lie to the North and the West, to ensure a quiet, private location and well manicured neighbours.
Set high on the hill just down from the police station overlooking Clunes township, this amazing block is only minutes' walk from the town centre, to provide a general peace of mind and a sense of calm.
Build the most stunning home, where views will provide a true WOW factor!
Power, water and sewerage are connected ready to build (STCA). It's even been recently surveyed to save you the trouble!

Description:
Almost 35 acress of Grazing on Three Titles
Ideally located just a stones throw from the Township of Clunes, this picturesque farmlet offers everything you will need to be self sufficient off the land. With spectacular scattered mature gums throughout this property has previously been planted to oats, though is now grass. The enormous dam has never been known to go dry, and is fed by a seasonal creek so refills very quickly each season. Many surrounding properties have access to bore water, so there is a good chance of being able to sink a bore if you would like to irrigate.
A comfortable double brick home is ready to move straight into, and offers three bedrooms all with built in robes, and the master has two way access to the large family bathroom. The north facing family room bathes in sun most of the day while presenting a wonderful floor to ceiling local stone fire surround as well as a split system, and opens onto the dining area spacious enough for the largest of dining tables. The country style kitchen has both electric cooking and a combustion stove for any chef to cook delicious meals in!
Also under roof is a double lock up garage, and separately the property offers a hay shed & large shed with concrete floor and power which has a cool room for meat, jams and pickles, or maybe tools? Attached to this is a chook shed with a door out to the orchard, containing plum, pear, apple and apricot trees.
If you are a keen bird lover, there is a large bank of aviaries, previously used to keep pheasant and peacocks in, though these could easily be converted into dog pens. A further shed houses a bay for milking, a pig pen and a smoke house. To finish the package, raised vegetable gardens to season all the delights to grow on the farm!
A comfortable home on a productive, well fenced property, or you may choose to purchase and build on one of the other titles? STCA of course. Sealed bitumen frontage on two sides for ease of access and convenience of town water.
Inspect today as this is truly a lovely parcel of land and needs to be seen to be truly appreciated.
> Town Water
> Almost 35 acres
> 3 separate titles
> Comfortable home
Insights: 3567 Ballarat - Maryborough Road, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2019 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Country home with country feel
With full encircled wide timber verandas, this four year old Bond home provides a practical yet homely design.
Perfectly replicating the natural grains and textures of real timber, the floor gleams from the reflections of the large picturesque double glazed windows, which ensure uninterrupted views and energy saving benefits.
The open plan living incorparting kitchen, dining room & lounge room has an energy saving single drawer dishwasher, electric hotplates and oven plus soft closing cabinetry, guaranteeing a functional space to prepare meals and dine with the family.
This home incorporates three bedrooms, a family bathroom and laundry with plenty of storage space which service all areas well.
Set on approximately 2279m2, this property provides security sensor lights on both the home and the garage that has plenty of workshop space, decent fencing and a fabulous watering system, which is contributed to by the extra water catchment from the 7x14m shed. A further potting shed provides a compact space to propagate plants or use as general storage space.
This home has a sense of simplicity, which becomes an uncomplicated place to raise a family. Situated just moments from the lovely township of Clunes with close proximity to the Primary school, sports ground and swimming pool and just a short drive to the buzzing town of Creswick, this home is marketed to sell.
Insights: 40 Albert Street, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2014 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Modern Family Home On Acreage
Set on approx. 4 acres is this beautiful family home with all of the modern comforts you could want. Featuring 4 bedrooms or 3 and a study, master with ensuite and double built in robe, spacious lounge room with hood heater and a formal lounge with split system air con, this home is ready to move in to with no hard work required. The kitchen contains a dishwasher, electric cooking, good bench space, walk in pantry and overlooks the dining area, alfresco and large backyard. Externally, you will be impressed with the layout of the property which lends itself to multiple possibilities. There are 2 small paddocks and 2 large paddocks for animals as well as a fenced backyard for the kids to play. There is plenty of shedding on offer with a 6m x 10m shed with two open bays and one enclosed as well as a wood shed and a work shed which could be converted to a bungalow as it has power connected and plastered.. Sit and relax in the alfresco area which overlooks the picturesque setting where peace and quiet is assured. The school bus stops at the front gate and the property is just a short drive from the Clunes town ship where there are shops, cafes and sporting facilities. Fairview Drive is located off Fairview Road. Inspect ASAP as we are sure you will be impressed.
Insights: 65 Fairview Drive, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2016 and 11 other 4 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
15 Acres Just Minutes from Creswick
A fantastic opportunity is available to purchase an exciting North facing allotment of (approx) 15 acres just five minutes drive to the thriving township of Creswick. With power passing the front entrance and fenced into one paddock, this flat farmlet would be ideal for grazing or perfect for a number of livestock.
Zoned Farming under the Hepburn Planning scheme, this parcel will require a planning permit approved from council for your dream home and you will need to justify why you need to live on site to conduct your rual pursuit. Carter Street, runs directly off McLennans Road and sits on the Ballarat side of the Clunes township. Be sure to drive by and then call our office to find out further details regarding this amazing piece of real estate.

Description:
Home plus 20 acres amongst the gum trees
Increasing environmental awareness has driven many of us to alter our living options to be more self-sufficient. With raised vegetable gardens, two dams, a huge supply of rain water, chook yard, two stables plus a prep and wash area along with 20 acres of land divided into three paddocks, ensure the ideal setting for managing a number of animals or pets or becoming a real hobby farmer.
Mature gums, quaint rock pond and native grasses surround this property along with the benefits of town water, garbage collection, septic, power, phone and internet, this home has all the conveniences of complete serenity of the country yet the ease of town living. Three bedrooms incorporating an oversized (4m x 4m) ensuite, a lovely cosy living area and an updated kitchen provide a family home with functionality as well as appeal. New plush carpets, large picturesque windows, unique slate tiling, wood burning heater, plus a split system ensure this home is warm and cool yet light throughout the seasons. Wheelchair access ramp plus long verandas both to the North and South provide an opportunity to watch the sun rise or set at any time of the day.
With wildlife in the distance and sealed road at your doorstep, along with convenience of Ballarat and Maryborough just 20 minutes away and Creswick a short drive, this property has the true diversification of country living. Be sure to drive past and feel the serenity.

Open plan living with new split system for easy heating and cooling. Enjoy the sunny aspect of the rear decking with a coffee while reading a good book. Under cover parking is taken care of with the 2 car carport. Neat easy care garden to the front and large back yard with good space to create your own garden paradise. Inspection by appointment.

Description:
Clunes Garden Oasis on approx 9 Acres
Peace and serenity surround in this tranquil garden oasis, a few minutes from the town centre of Clunes. Previously an organic herb farm, the grounds are impeccably maintained and presented, with one area fully irrigated with sprinklers which could easily be transformed into vegetables, or an orchard. The sturdy brick veneer home built by local builder Max Carson consists of three bedrooms with the master offering large walk in robe and roomy ensuite. The kitchen and dining are open plan, with a cosy Ned Kelly heater to warm you on those chilly nights, which then steps down into a sunken lounge with gorgeous open fire place and air conditioning. The lounge has wonderful colonial windows overlooking the garden where you can sit and watch the sun or moon rise over the tree tops. The main bathroom is fully appointed, and the laundry is large enough for a spare fridge or freezer. Outside there is plenty of shedding including a double garage with store room and work bench while leading off this is a large shed with timber floor which is currently set up with 4 sheep pens and a space for shearing, as well as a holding pen outside. A separate single garage stands beside a carport, perfect for storing the caravan! Chook sheds are to be found in the back yard with covered out door enclosures attached a veritable chook paradise! A cat enclosure has been built off the rear of the home, offering an outdoor play area for puss, while still protecting the local wildlife, which abounds, as Kilkenny Creek runs through the property, offering a year round water supply for local birds and animals. The property offers many additional features including a 1.5 KW solar system back to grid; Bore, mains and tank water; dam; underground power, 2 separate paddocks, 2 large yards with sheep shelters and fruit trees such as cherry, apricot, pear, plum, apple, nectarine and quince. The property is bordered by two roads as well as the Ballarat/Maryborough railway line, and is close to Mt Beckwith, walking tracks, train station, shops and Health Centre.
This is a wonderful lifestyle property, and your inspection will not disappoint!

Description:
Large Family Home - Elevated Clunes Position
An ideal alternative to accommodating your; parents, teenage child or even guests. This fascinating four bedroom home includes a self contained unit under the same roofline, to create a perfect solution to adjust many intricate family circumstances. An eclectic mix of timber, lead lighting and soaring ceilings provides an attention-grabbing home with real soul. The earthy kitchen and meals area provides an amazing slate floor with detailed cabinetry and electric cooking, whilst the family bathroom is just a further bonus to this three bathroom home. Heated and cooled by a split system and wood fire, this home is generally temperature controlled by the natural light and breeze which flows through.
Completely encircled by wide verandas and entertaining hub, this residence sits high over the sweeping land of Clunes countryside, yet provides the convenience of minutes to the township and the home is set well back from the road. With lush grazing land and fenced paddock this home would also suit those with animal care in mind. Services to the home include town water, mains power, telephone and septic tank. The tradesperson will enjoy the two large sheds that adjoin one another, both serviced with power (separate meter box), concrete floor and enough storage for 8 cars. Be sure to inspect this picturesque farm let, contact our Ballarat office for further information.

Description:
Large Building Block Close to Train Station
Located close to the Clunes train station and backing onto the showgrounds this large allotment offers a tranquil location close to all the idyllic town of Clunes has to offer. Well known for Book Town Weekend and Hollywood movie sets, Clunes Township is just a short walk down the road.
Power, water and sewerage are connected ready to build your dream home on STCA. With only the neighbour's back yard between you and amazing views across the valley, secure this lovely block today!
